title: Thomas Meunier reveals Toffees interest and says he always wanted to stay at PSG
text:
Paris Saint Germain defender Thomas Meunier has revealed that he was close to joining Everton this summer, but a move failed to materialise due to the Toffees' lack of European football.

The Belgium international has one year remaining on his current deal with the French champions, with many expecting the full back to leave the Parc des Princes in the summer.

However, a transfer away from the club didn't come to fruition, and the 28-year-old has revealed that he was close to joining Premier League side Everton, but the Merseyside club not playing in Europe this season proved to be a stumbling block.

Thomas Meunier has revealed that he was close to joining Everton in the summer window

However, the 28-year-old said that a lack of European football proved to be a stumbling block

Speaking to Belgian newspaper Het Laatste Nieuws, Meunier said: 'There was interest and there have been conversations, but it never came to a point where I had to decide: Do I sign or not? Always one of the parties did not agree.'

When asked whether the breakdown was frustrating, he said: 'No, because I have always made it clear that my ambition was to stay with PSG. I did not want to leave.

'Because playing at PSG is special. You are part of a team that can win a European competition, that is not something many players can say.

Everton have had a poor start to the season and are on a four game losing streak in the league

'I could have signed with Everton – a good club. I would have played a lot, that's for sure, and had a lot of fun too.

'But Everton doesn't play in European competition.'

The signing of a player with Meunier's pedigree would have been something of a coup for Everton, who are struggling in the Premier League under Marco Silva this season.

They host West Ham on Saturday in the hope of breaking a losing run of four games that has many questioning the manager's position at the club.
description: The Belgium international has one year remaining on his current deal with the French champions, with many expecting the full back to leave the Parc des Princes in the summer for the Premier League.
